title: Solidarity in natural gas storage: A potential allocation mechanism of stored quantities among several players during times of crisis. (arXiv:2209.05089v2 [econ.GN] UPDATED)
abstract: The recently experienced disruptions in the EU's energy supply pointed out that supply crises pose a real thread and the member states must be better prepared do deal with the related challenges. According to the current practice, member states fill their gas storages independently, while it is not clear how solidarity could be put into practice in the future, i.e. how the accumulated reserves of one or more members may be potentially redistributed to help others in need. In this paper we propose some possible guidelines for a potential solidarity framework, and formalize a game-theoretic model in order to capture the basic features of the problem, considering the related uncertainty of the future conditions related to gas storage levels and possible transmission bottlenecks as well. The proposed mechanism of supply-security related cooperation is based on voluntary participation, and may contribute to the more efficient utilization of storage capacities. translated_title: 天然气储存中的团结：危机期间多个参与者之间存储量的潜在分配机制
translated_abstract: 最近欧盟能源供应的中断表明供应危机构成了真正的威胁，成员国必须更好地准备应对相关挑战。根据目前的做法，成员国独立填充其天然气储备，而未来如何实行团结尚不明确，即如何可能重新分配一个或多个成员的积累储备来帮助其他成员。本文提出了一些潜在团结框架的指导方针，并通过建立博弈论模型来捕捉该问题的基本特征，考虑与天然气储存水平和可能的输电瓶颈相关的未来条件的不确定性。提出的供应安全相关合作机制基于自愿参与，可以促进储存能力的更有效利用。
tldr: 本文提出了一种潜在的团结框架，用于解决天然气储备在危机期间的分配问题。通过建立博弈论模型和考虑不确定性因素，该机制基于自愿参与，并可以促进储存能力的更有效利用。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a potential solidarity framework for the allocation of gas reserves during crises. The mechanism is based on voluntary participation and aims to enhance the efficient utilization of storage capacities by considering uncertainties and utilizing game theory.
